After getting through the tutorial and into the actual game environments, I was blown away by how close Crytek have managed to get the Quest version's graphics to those I remember from the Rift years ago.

Each area has three different climbs for a total of nine climbs in the game, and they do get more challenging as you progress. The trick to make it feel realistic is to not press the grip button all the way down, but to instead have finesse and hold so the indicator is blue instead of white. This actually requires focus and a steady grip, and risks being too soft and slipping off. Not too hard but not too light with your grip. Additionally, you can chalk your hands to increase the stamina of that hand for difficult sections that force you to reach farther or hang from one hand. The jumps are pretty challenging at first, especially if you use the natural method of physically pushing off a wall with hand motion instead of the jump button.

You earn rewards for various achievements or finding things on your climbs to unlock new gear for your hands (watches, gloves, wristbands).

Theres also no feeling of depth/distance, if you look to the distance its just a picture paste job which makes sense but if you look out in the distance and turn your head semi quick and look to the edge of the lens left or right you can see the bad clipping of the picture paste job that was done, it breaks the emersion and made me not want to look out nd enjoy the view because ironically it wasn't good,

There also seems to be slight imput lag with the controllers, only slight but it shouldn't be there and might annoy some people, all in all given the time this port has taken and the devs being Crytek its a bad port but i suspect they was working on a more important AAA game at the same time which results in this half okay half shoddy port, the game is crossbuy and thats a Pluss, however this Wireless version should of been The Version to play, its a missed opportunity and honestly another stain on Cryteks Rep, if you commit to making/porting a game then put your best foot forward,

If you bought the Rift Version long ago then its worth a try atleast but if you are new and looking to buy, i recommend the Rift Version, however if your set on this Version then wait for Deep Discount
